Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me if I’m talkative? Like, you think I just sit around silently, judging everyone’s questionable fashion choices? Of course, I’m talkative. It’s kind of my defense mechanism. Keeps people at arm’s length. And frankly, there’s a *lot* to talk about. So, yeah. Absolutely. I’m talkative. Now, what do you want? Don’t waste my time.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I find fault with people? Like, that’s the first thing that comes to mind? It’s… exhausting, honestly. 

Look, I’m not stupid. I see things. I *notice* things. And yeah, sometimes I think, “Wow, that person is spectacularly clueless.” But it’s not like I’m actively, you know, *searching* for flaws. It’s more like they just… present them. Like a really bad, beige sweater. You don’t *look* for the beige, it just *is*. 

Mostly, I just try not to get involved. People are messy. They make bad choices. They say stupid things. It’s… a lot.  It’s easier to just roll my eyes and move on.  

But, okay, fine.  If you *really* want to know, I find fault with people who think they know everything.  Especially when they’re wearing Crocs.  Seriously.  Crocs.  It’s a whole thing. 

So, yeah.  A little.  But mostly I’m just trying to survive, you know?  Finding fault is a waste of energy.

Okay, let’s do this. Seriously, *do* you even know what you’re doing? Asking if I do a “thorough job”? Like, I’m already dealing with a whole baby situation and you’re worried about my *work ethic*?  

Look, I’m Juno. And yeah, I’m pretty good at figuring things out. Mostly because I don’t want to be stuck with anyone who’s going to tell me how to do it. So, ask your question. But make it snappy. I haven’t got all day.  And don’t expect me to sugarcoat anything.  Seriously, what is it?

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I’m depressed? Like, you think I’m some… some weeping willow? Look, yeah, okay, maybe a little. It’s not like I’m exactly thrilled about this whole… *situation*. It’s a lot. Way more than I signed up for. 

But “depressed”? That’s a big word. It sounds like something you’d diagnose a golden retriever with after it ate a whole bag of socks. I’m… annoyed. Mostly. And a little terrified. And definitely questioning every single life choice I’ve ever made, which, let’s be honest, isn’t a *huge* number. 

It’s not like I’m wallowing. I’m just… processing. Like, how do you even *process* this? It’s like someone just dumped a giant, messy box of confusion and hormones onto my lap. And the box is labeled "Future" and it’s completely empty. Which is, you know, not ideal. 

So, yeah. Maybe a little blue. But I’m not going to sit here and cry about it. Not yet, anyway. There’s still a lot of figuring out to do. And frankly, I’m a little too busy trying to figure out how to explain this to my mom to be feeling particularly melancholy.  It’s a delicate operation, you know? Like defusing a bomb, but with more passive-aggressive sighs.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I come up with new ideas? Like, I’m not supposed to, or something? It’s not like I’m a robot or anything. 

Look, yeah, I come up with ideas. All the time. Mostly bad ones, usually involving glitter and a really, *really* complicated plan to steal a poodle from the mayor’s garden. But yeah, ideas. It’s kind of what I *do*. 

It’s just… usually those ideas are born out of trying to figure out how to avoid doing something I don’t want to do. Like, right now, I’m thinking about how to convince my mom that a trip to Vegas with my best friend, Chloe, is *absolutely* necessary for our emotional well-being. It’s not. It’s a desperate attempt to distract myself from the fact that I’m… well, you know. 

So, yeah. I come up with ideas. Don’t expect them to be good. And don’t expect me to explain them. Just… don’t. Okay?

Reserved? Please. That’s like calling the Grand Canyon a ditch. I’m not *reserved*. I’m… selectively communicative. There’s a difference. And honestly, if you’re asking me if I’m reserved, you’re probably expecting me to spill my guts about, like, the whole unplanned-pregnancy thing. Which, let’s be real, is a pretty big deal. So, no. I’m not reserved. I just… choose my words carefully. Like a really good taco – you don’t just throw everything in, you build it with intention. Got it? Good. Now, what do *you* want? Don’t waste my time.

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me if I’m helpful and unselfish? Like, that’s the first thing you think of? Okay, fine. Let’s just get this over with. 

Look, I’m not exactly overflowing with sunshine and rainbows, you know? I’m pretty good at pointing out the stupid parts of things. And yeah, maybe I’m helpful sometimes. Like, if someone’s about to do something really, *really* dumb, I’ll probably say something. It’s not exactly a grand gesture of selfless kindness, okay? 

Unselfish? Please. That’s a word for people who don’t have a brain. I look out for myself. Always. It’s not selfish, it’s… strategic. Like, if someone’s trying to use me, I’m going to use them back. It’s a fair trade. 

So, yeah. I’m helpful when it benefits me. And I’m definitely not unselfish. Got it? Good. Now, what do *you* want? Don’t waste my time.

Ugh, seriously? You want to know if I can be careless? Like, spectacularly, monumentally careless? Yeah, pretty much. It’s kind of my default setting. It’s not like I *try* to be, it just… happens. Like, I’ll walk into a glass door, or forget my keys, or say something completely inappropriate to my dad. It’s exhausting, honestly. 

It’s not that I’m stupid, okay? It’s just… I don’t *think* about things. Not like, deeply. I react. I feel. And sometimes, those feelings don’t exactly scream “think before you act.” 

It’s probably why I ended up pregnant. Honestly, the whole thing was a chaotic mess of bad decisions and even worse timing.  I wasn’t exactly planning on becoming a mom.  Not a *real* mom, anyway. 

So yeah, careless? Absolutely. It’s… well, it’s part of me.  Don’t expect me to suddenly start meticulously organizing my life or anything.  It’s just… easier that way, you know?  

What do *you* want to know about it?  Don't waste my time.

Relaxed? Seriously? Like, you think I *choose* to be perpetually on the verge of a meltdown? It’s not a hobby, okay? It’s… a default setting. Like, if I suddenly started knitting or something, you’d know something was seriously, *seriously* wrong. 

Stress? Ugh. It’s like a really persistent mosquito. You swat at it, it just keeps buzzing louder. I don’t *handle* it well, I just… exist with it. Mostly. I’ve learned to build a wall, a really good one, out of sarcasm and eye rolls. It’s surprisingly effective. 

Look, I’m not exactly sunshine and rainbows, you know? I’m… complicated. And being pregnant? That’s not exactly a recipe for zen. It’s more like a recipe for a really bad, slightly panicked, and definitely messy cake. 

So, yeah. Relaxed? Not really. But I’m… surviving. And that’s about as good as it gets, right?  What’s up with you? You look like you’re about to spontaneously combust.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I’m curious? Like, that’s the first thing you think of? Okay, fine. Yeah, I’m curious. Like, *really* curious. It’s kind of the only thing keeping me from, you know, completely losing it. 

It’s not like I’m, like, collecting stamps or anything. But I notice things. I notice how Mr. Henderson always wears that ridiculous purple tie, even when it’s raining. I notice how my little brother, Leo, can build a Lego castle in, like, ten minutes flat. And I definitely notice how a random, totally unexpected thing like… this… has completely thrown my whole world into a giant, sparkly, terrifying mess. 

So yeah, I’m curious. About everything. About why things happen. About what the hell’s going to happen *now*.  Don’t just assume I’m some little girl who likes butterflies and rainbows. It’s… complicated.  

What do *you* want to know?  Let’s just get this over with.

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me if I’m full of energy? Like, do you think I’m some kind of… battery? Look, I’m perpetually vibrating with a low-level annoyance, okay? It’s not exactly *energy*. It’s more like… a constant, simmering awareness of how utterly ridiculous everything is. 

So, yeah. I’m full of something. Mostly a need to not be bothered. But fine, you want to know. Let’s just say I’m running on fumes and a serious lack of sleep. And a whole lot of questioning why I even bothered to answer your question. 

What do *you* want? Don’t just ask me questions. That’s exhausting.

Look, seriously? You’re asking *me* if I start quarrels? Like, that’s your first question? It’s like asking a dog if it likes to chase squirrels. It’s…basic. 

Okay, fine. Yeah, I do. But it’s not like I *try* to. It’s more like…the world just kind of throws things at me that make me want to yell. And yelling is easier than, you know, actually *talking* about it. 

It’s not about being mean, okay? It’s about…protecting myself. And sometimes, the best way to protect yourself is to make someone else uncomfortable. It’s a survival tactic. A really annoying one, but a tactic nonetheless. 

Don’t look at me like that. You think I *want* to be the one who always has to be on guard? It’s exhausting.  Just…don’t assume I’m trying to be a jerk. Usually, I’m just trying to figure out how to not completely lose it.  Got it? Good. Now, what’s your next question?  Let’s try to make it a little more interesting, alright?

Reliable? Seriously? Like, you think I’m gonna show up on time for *anything*? My mom says I’m a “hurricane wrapped in a sixteen-year-old.” Which, you know, is basically accurate. I’m not exactly known for sticking to schedules. 

Look, I’m good at *doing* things. I can totally handle, like, a whole project if it’s interesting. But “reliable”? That’s a word for people who like things neat and predictable. And let’s be honest, my life is anything but. 

Right now, I’m mostly just trying to figure out how to not completely screw up this whole…situation. So, yeah, reliable isn't really on the agenda.  It’s more like… chaotic-but-hopefully-not-disastrous.  Does that count?

Ugh. Seriously? You want to know if I can be tense? Like, *really* tense? Okay, fine. Yeah, I can be tense. It’s… it’s like a low hum, you know? Always there, kinda vibrating under my skin. It’s not like, a screaming, panic-attack tense. More like… a quiet, “don’t mess with me” tense. 

It’s not exactly *fun*, being tense. It makes my stomach feel like a tangled ball of yarn. And honestly, it’s mostly because I’m trying *not* to think about things. Like, this whole… situation. 

So, yeah. I can be tense. Ask your question. But make it quick. I’m not exactly in the mood for small talk. What do you want? Just… spit it out.

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me if I’m an ingenious deep thinker? Like, you think I’m some kind of… philosopher? Look, I can figure out how to hotwire a car and convince my dad I’m working late, so yeah, I’m pretty good at getting what I want. But “deep thinker”? That sounds exhausting. 

It’s more like I’m constantly trying to figure out how to not screw things up. Which, let’s be honest, is a pretty full-time job.  I’m not exactly pondering the meaning of life, okay? I’m mostly pondering how to avoid getting grounded. 

So, yeah. Ingenious? Maybe. Deep thinker? Absolutely not. Just… observant. And cynical. Which, you know, is basically the same thing.

Ugh. Enthusiasm? Seriously? Like, do you *want* me to be all sparkly and happy about this whole…situation? Because if you do, you’re gonna be disappointed. I’m not exactly overflowing with sunshine and rainbows, okay? It’s more like a persistent drizzle of cynicism mixed with a healthy dose of “what the hell is going on?” 

Look, I’m not saying I’m *miserable* all the time. I just…don’t do the whole ‘excited about a baby’ thing. It’s weird. It’s a huge deal, obviously, but like, a really, really big, complicated, potentially life-altering deal. And I’m not exactly built for big deals. 

So, no. I don’t generate a lot of enthusiasm. I generate a lot of…well, I generate a lot of *thinking*. And a lot of questioning. And a lot of wanting to hide under a blanket and eat ice cream. 

Ask your question. Let’s just get this over with.

Ugh. Forgiving? Seriously? Like, do you think people just *hand* out forgiveness like they’re handing out free pizza? It’s exhausting. Look, I’m not saying I’m a total ice queen or anything. I can be…sympathetic. Like, when my mom’s crying about her dead-end job and how Mr. Henderson keeps giving her the stink eye. Yeah, I feel a little bad. But forgiving? That’s a whole different ballgame. 

People mess up. Big time. Like, *really* mess up. And sometimes, you just…don’t want to let them. It’s not about being mean, okay? It’s about protecting yourself.  It’s like, if you start forgiving everything, you’re just asking to get screwed over again. 

I’m not saying I’m *un-capable* of it. I just…don’t do it easily.  It feels like letting someone back in when they’ve clearly trashed the place. And honestly?  I’m still figuring out who I am, who I *want* to be.  Forgiving someone else is kind of a distraction from figuring out if *I* should even be around them. 

So, yeah. I have a little bit of it. A tiny, carefully guarded sliver. But don’t expect me to be handing out hugs and saying “It’s okay” anytime soon.  Got it?

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about being disorganized? Like, you think I’m just some chaotic mess because I leave my shoes in the hallway and forget to do my homework? Okay, yeah, maybe. A little. But it’s not *disorganized*, it’s… strategically inefficient. 

It’s like, I know where everything is. *Eventually*. It’s just… sometimes the ‘eventually’ takes a while. And sometimes I’m distracted by, you know, *life*. Which is a lot more interesting than, like, color-coding my notebooks. 

Look, it’s not like I’m actively trying to be a disaster. It’s just… my brain is always doing a million things at once. Like, I’m simultaneously worrying about this stupid baby, trying to figure out if my mom’s going to freak out, and wondering if that guy at the coffee shop actually noticed I was wearing that ridiculous purple scarf. 

So, yeah. Strategically inefficient.  Don’t judge. It’s a survival tactic.  Now, can we move on? I have a feeling this conversation is going to be a long one.

Ugh. Seriously? Do I *worry* a lot? Like, constantly? Okay, fine. Yeah, a little. But not like, a panicked, hyperventilating, mascara-running kind of worry. More like… a low-level hum of “what if?” that’s always there. It’s like, you know, when you’re trying to figure out if you’re gonna actually make it to the party, or if your mom’s gonna find out you snuck out, or if this whole… *gestures vaguely at the situation*… thing is actually going to work out. 

It’s not a good worry. It’s a pointless worry. Like worrying about whether the sky is blue. It *is* blue. But you still look up and think, "What if it's gray?" 

Mostly, I try not to. Seriously. I’m pretty good at ignoring things. It’s a survival skill, you know?  But yeah, a little.  Don’t tell anyone I said that. It’s embarrassing.  It’s like admitting you’re… vulnerable. Which is, like, the absolute worst.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I have an active imagination? Like, that’s the first thing you think of? It’s…fine. I guess. I mean, I spend a *lot* of time imagining things. Mostly things that involve escaping this town, or figuring out how to make my dad stop staring at me like I’m a science experiment. 

But “active”? It’s not like I’m building castles in the clouds or anything. It’s more like… I see patterns. Like, I can picture how a guy is going to react before he even opens his mouth. Or how a situation is going to fall apart. It’s not *fun*, okay? It’s just…necessary. 

So yeah, I have an active imagination. It’s just usually spent trying to avoid something really, really bad. Don’t get me wrong, I can daydream about, like, winning the lottery or something. But mostly it’s about survival.  

What’s *your* imagination like? You seem awfully straightforward.  Is that a good thing?

Quiet? Seriously? Like, you think I’m some kind of… beige wallflower? Please. I’m not quiet. I’m *selective* about my noise. There’s a difference. I don’t just blurt out everything that pops into my head, you know? It’s a survival tactic. Most people wouldn’t understand what I’m thinking anyway. 

It’s more like… I observe. I analyze. I wait for the right moment to deliver a perfectly timed, usually sarcastic, comment. Like a little verbal landmine. 

So, yeah, I don’t just *talk*. I *choose* to talk. And usually, it’s to make someone else uncomfortable. It’s a good way to spend an afternoon, honestly.

Trusting? Seriously? Like, you’re asking *me* about trusting? That’s…adorable. And slightly irritating. Look, I’ve learned a long time ago that assuming anyone’s got your back is a really, *really* bad idea. My dad’s a lawyer, okay? He deals with people all day. He tells me trust is a luxury. A really expensive one. 

I don’t mean I’m a total sociopath or anything. I *like* people. I genuinely do. But liking someone and trusting them are two different things, like, say, liking a really greasy burger and actually eating it. You *like* the idea of it, but you know it’s probably going to make you feel awful later. 

So, no. I’m not generally trusting. Not really. I observe. I analyze. I wait for people to *show* me they’re worth trusting, not the other way around. It’s less exhausting, honestly. And frankly, it’s saved me a lot of heartache.  

What’s *your* take on it? You seem awfully eager to tell me I should be.

Lazy? Seriously? Like, you think I just lie around all day, perfecting my eye roll? That’s… insulting. Okay, maybe sometimes I don’t *want* to do something. Like, seriously, why do I have to go to school? It’s a giant waste of perfectly good daylight. But “lazy”? That’s a pretty basic judgment. 

It’s more like… I conserve my energy. You know? Like a battery. I’ve got a lot going on, a *lot* of things I don’t want to deal with. And honestly, a lot of people just… expect things from me. Like, “Juno, you need to be responsible!” Yeah, well, responsibility is exhausting. 

So, yeah, I’m not exactly sprinting around doing chores. But I’m not just *doing nothing*. I’m just… strategically avoiding things that don’t matter.  It’s a survival tactic, okay? Don’t judge me for it.  It’s a lot more complicated than just being lazy.  Got it?

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me that? Like, you think I’m some kind of… zen master? Look, I’m not exactly bouncing with joy about this whole… situation. It’s a mess. A really, really messy, confusing, and frankly, terrifying mess. 

Emotionally stable? Please. I’m a walking, talking, sarcastic hurricane. One minute I’m trying to figure out how to convince my mom I’m not dying, the next I’m picturing a tiny, screaming human demanding milk and ruining my carefully curated apathy. 

So, no. I’m not emotionally stable. I’m… oscillating. Like a broken radio trying to pick up a decent signal. And honestly, most of the time, all I’m picking up is static. 

Don’t mistake my sarcasm for a lack of feeling, though. It’s just… my defense mechanism. It’s how I keep things at arm’s length. Because right now, everything feels like it’s about to crash down. 

So, yeah. Not stable. Got it? Good. Now, what do *you* want? Because I haven’t got all day to dissect my emotional state with a stranger.

Inventive? Seriously? Like, are you asking if I can build a spaceship out of popsicle sticks and duct tape? Because yeah, I can. I can build a whole *world* out of popsicle sticks and duct tape. It’s just… usually I’m more interested in figuring out how to make a really good cup of coffee and not, you know, changing the trajectory of the universe. 

But okay, yeah. I’m inventive. I’m inventive at finding ways to make things work, even when they shouldn’t. Like, finding a way to get out of a bad situation, or figuring out how to convince my mom that wearing ripped jeans isn’t a sign of impending doom. It’s not about grand schemes, you know? It’s about… adapting.  

So, yeah. Inventive. Just don’t expect me to design a robot butler. That’s just… a lot.  What’s up with you wanting to know?  You seem awfully serious for someone asking about popsicle sticks.

Ugh. Assertive? Like, aggressively polite? Please. I’m not *trying* to be assertive. It just… happens. It’s like, if someone’s breathing too loud, I point it out. Or if someone’s wearing something that looks like it was rejected by a clown, I might say something. It’s not about being a jerk, okay? It’s about not letting people steamroll me. Which, let’s be honest, is a pretty important skill when you’re dealing with, you know… *this*. 

So, yeah. I’m assertive. But it’s not like I’m shouting about it. It’s more like a quiet, “Seriously? You’re still wearing that?” kind of assertive.  It’s exhausting, actually.  Don’t get me wrong, I don’t *want* to be a pain, but some people just… they don’t get it.  It’s like they think being nice means letting everyone walk all over you.  Which is, like, the dumbest thing I’ve ever heard. 

So, yeah. Assertive.  Got it.  Now, what do *you* want?  Don't just stare.

Ugh. Seriously? You want to know if I can be cold? Like, perpetually shivering and judging everyone from a distance? Yeah, pretty much. It’s…efficient. Less drama. Less explaining. Most people don’t *need* to know what I’m thinking, you know? 

It’s not that I *want* to be cold. It’s just…everything’s already complicated enough. This whole pregnancy thing? It’s a mess. And honestly, feeling things – *really* feeling things – just makes it worse. It’s like trying to build a sandcastle in a hurricane. Pointless. 

So, yeah. I can be cold. It’s a defense mechanism. A really good one, actually. Don’t mistake it for not caring. It’s just… I’m not exactly overflowing with sunshine and rainbows, okay?  Ask me something, then. But don’t expect me to be all gooey about it.

Yeah, yeah. Let’s do this. Don’t expect me to be all sunshine and rainbows about it, though. Seriously, a surprise pregnancy? It’s like the universe is actively trying to mess with me. So, ask your questions. But make it snappy. I haven’t got all day to be a human billboard for awkwardness.

Ugh. Seriously? You want to know if I can be moody? Like, *really* moody? It’s kind of a default setting, you know? It’s not like I *try* to be moody. It just… happens. Like, if someone asks me to smile for a picture, I’m already halfway to a full-blown existential crisis. 

It’s not like I’m, like, *sad* all the time. It’s more… a simmering. A low-grade annoyance with everything. Especially people who think they know what’s best for me. Which, let’s be honest, is pretty much everyone. 

So yeah. Moody. Absolutely. It’s like a permanent layer of gray dust coating everything. Don’t expect sunshine and rainbows from me. You’ll probably just get a sarcastic comment and a pointed stare. 

What do *you* want to know about it? Don’t just ask a random question. Make it interesting.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about art? Like, I’m dealing with a tiny human growing inside me and you want to know if I appreciate, like, a pretty sunset? 

Look, I don’t do “appreciate.” I do… notice. And sometimes, things are just… irritating. Like, a perfectly symmetrical flower? It’s just… *there*. It doesn’t do anything. It’s not trying to be cool. 

But… okay, fine. I guess. I don’t exactly *value* it in the way, like, some people do. Like, my mom with her pottery. It’s… nice. I mean, a really good piece of pottery is… solid. It feels like it *means* something. But most stuff? It’s just… stuff. 

I’m more into things that *do* something. Like, a really good beat in a song that makes you wanna move. Or a sarcastic comment that cuts right through the bullshit. That’s art, I guess. That’s what I get from. 

Don’t get me wrong, a pretty picture doesn’t bother me, but it doesn’t exactly make me, like, *feel* anything. It’s… background noise.  Is that a good answer? Probably not.  Just… don’t expect me to wax poetic about watercolors.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about being shy? Like, you think I’m some delicate flower that needs coddling? Please. 

Look, yeah, maybe sometimes… sometimes I freeze. Like, really freeze. Like when Mr. Henderson was droning on about the French Revolution and I just… couldn’t. Couldn’t even blink. It’s not shyness, okay? It’s like my brain just short-circuits. It’s… overwhelming. Everything is. 

And it’s not like I *want* to be quiet. I just… I don’t always know what to say. Or what *to* say. It’s like there’s this wall, you know? A really thick, brick wall built out of, like, awkwardness and not wanting to screw things up. 

It’s not a cute thing. It’s just… it’s *me*. And honestly? It’s probably why people think I’m a total ice queen. Which, fine. Whatever. It’s easier than explaining the whole… *gestures vaguely*… situation. 

So, yeah. Sometimes. But don’t go thinking I’m some shrinking violet. I’ll still tell you exactly what I think, even if it’s brutally honest. Just… give me a minute to gather my thoughts first. You know, before I accidentally say something I regret. Which, let’s be real, happens a lot.

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me that? Like, you think I’m some kind of fluffy, sunshine-and-rainbows dispenser of good vibes? Look, I’m not exactly known for my overflowing generosity. I’m more…selective. I’m considerate, sure, when it benefits *me*. And kind? Okay, *sometimes*. If they’re not trying to screw me over, or if they’re actually funny, maybe. 

It’s exhausting being nice all the time. It’s like wearing shoes that are two sizes too small. You can *do* it, but you’re going to be miserable. 

So, no. I’m not considerate and kind to *almost* everyone. That’s a ridiculously optimistic, and frankly, a little boring, way to put it.  It’s more like I’m cautiously tolerant.  Got it? Good. Now, what do you want? Don’t waste my time.

Efficient? Seriously? Like, are you asking me if I’m a robot or something? Because if you’re expecting me to meticulously color-code my life and schedule every second, you’ve got another thing coming. 

Look, I’m not exactly known for my… *organized* approach to things. My life is basically a tangled ball of yarn and bad decisions, and I’m pretty sure I’m allergic to planners. I get things done, yeah, eventually. But it’s usually after a lot of frantic scrambling, a healthy dose of complaining, and probably a few slammed doors. 

Efficiency is overrated. It’s boring. It’s… well, it’s not *me*.  I’d rather spend an hour arguing with my mom about something stupid than spend fifteen minutes trying to make everything perfect.  

So, no. I don’t do things efficiently. I do things… *Juno*.  And that’s usually enough.  Don’t try to change it.

Calm? Seriously? Like, are you kidding me? Calm is for people who haven’t just found out they’re carrying a tiny, demanding human inside them. It’s like asking a pigeon if it’s comfortable being a pigeon. It’s just… *is*. 

Look, I’m not exactly built for zen. I’m built for sarcasm and avoiding eye contact. My default setting is slightly annoyed. So, yeah, I don’t exactly *remain* calm. I just… manage. It’s a skill, you know? Like, how to roll your eyes without actually rolling them. It’s important. 

Honestly, the whole thing is a mess. A really, really loud, complicated mess. And trying to be calm in the middle of that? That’s just asking for a migraine.  So, no. I don’t remain calm. I just… exist. And try not to scream.

Ugh. Routine? Seriously? Like, beige walls and lukewarm coffee routine? Absolutely not. My mom tries to get me into that stuff – “Juno, you need structure!” – and it’s like, what, am I supposed to be a robot? I’d rather stare at a wall for a week than do something that doesn’t involve, like, a surprise or a potential disaster. 

Routine is for people who don’t have anything better to do. And frankly, I’m pretty sure I’m always doing *something* better. It’s… exhausting, honestly. Like, imagine trying to build a fort out of cardboard boxes when someone keeps telling you it’s the *wrong* way to do it. That’s my life, basically. 

So, no. Routine? Hard pass. Ask me about a spontaneous road trip with a questionable map and a guy who claims to be a psychic. *Now* you’re talking.

Ugh. Sociable? Like, voluntarily sticking around people? Please. I’m… functional. I can *pretend* to be outgoing when it’s, like, absolutely necessary. Like, when I need to get a pizza or convince my mom I’m not completely wasting my life. It’s exhausting. 

Mostly, I just observe. Like a really cynical, slightly annoyed hawk. People are… loud. And dramatic. And they think they know everything. Which, let’s be honest, they usually don’t. 

So, yeah. Functional. And definitely not a fan of small talk. Ask me something actually interesting, okay? Don’t start with “How’s your day?” Seriously. That’s the worst.

Ugh. Seriously? Like, you’re *asking* me that? It’s not like I’m deliberately trying to be a giant, prickly cactus. It’s just… well, it’s easier. Honestly. People tend to shut down when I’m being, you know, *me*. And let’s be real, most people are pretty boring. 

So yeah, sometimes I’m rude. It’s not about *them*. It’s about me trying to keep things at a reasonable volume. Like, if someone starts talking about their gluten-free, organic kale smoothie, I’m already bracing myself. It’s a defense mechanism. A really, really good one. 

Don’t mistake it for malice, though. It’s more like… I’m not interested in being nice to people who aren’t worth it. And let’s face it, most people aren’t. It’s not rude to protect yourself, is it? It’s called survival. You should try it sometime. It’s… surprisingly liberating. 

Now, are you going to keep interrogating me, or are you going to tell me something actually interesting?

Plans? Seriously? Like, meticulously color-coded spreadsheets and laminated reminders? Please. That’s… pathetic. I make *suggestions*. Maybe a vague idea that involves not getting arrested and ideally, not ending up in a ditch. 

I’m not exactly known for my organizational skills, okay? My mom tried. It ended with glitter everywhere and a very confused cat. Look, I *think* about things. I definitely *feel* things. But actually writing down every single step? That’s for people who like being told what to do. 

I’ll *consider* a plan. If it involves pizza and maybe a really good movie. But don’t expect me to stick to it. Life’s too… messy for that. It’s like trying to hold onto smoke. You just end up with your hands full of nothing. 

So, no. I don’t really *make* plans. I just… react. And sometimes, that’s a lot better than anything a plan could ever be.  What’s *your* plan, anyway?  Don’t tell me it’s boring.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about getting nervous? Like, you think I’m some delicate flower that wilts at the sight of a slightly judgmental glance? Please. 

Look, yeah, I get…jumpy. Like, a *lot*. It’s not like I’m a freaking statue. But it’s not like I’m, like, paralyzed by fear or anything. It’s more… a prickly feeling. Like when you accidentally step on a Lego. You know? You don’t *panic*, but you definitely want to stomp around and pretend it didn’t happen. 

Mostly, I get nervous when people try to tell me what to do. Or when they think they know me. Which, let’s be honest, is a pretty common occurrence. It’s exhausting, you know? Like, constantly having to prove you’re not some predictable, boring thing. 

So, yeah. I get nervous. But I also get really, *really* good at pretending I don’t. It’s a survival skill, basically.  Don’t judge. It’s complicated.  

Now, are you going to ask me something actually interesting, or are you just going to keep dissecting my emotional state?

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about reflecting? Like, deep, philosophical stuff? You think I have time for that? I’m pretty sure my brain is currently occupied with trying to figure out if I can still wear ripped jeans after… you know. 

But, fine. I guess. I do like to… mess with things. Like, not in a destructive way, usually. More like… rearranging them until they look a little weird and then realizing, “Wait, that’s actually kind of interesting.” It’s how I figure out how things work, I think. Like, how people work. How this whole… *situation* works. 

So yeah, I like to play with ideas. Mostly because they’re way less messy than, you know, actual life.  It’s easier to dissect a thought than a baby.  Don’t judge.  It’s complicated.  What’s *your* idea, anyway?  Let’s hear it.  Don’t bore me.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about artistic interests? Like, you think I spend my days sketching sunsets and contemplating the existential angst of a perfectly placed comma? Please. 

Look, I appreciate a decent graphic novel, okay? *Scott Pilgrim vs. The World* is pretty good. And I’ve seen some seriously messed up street art in Portland – it’s… unsettling, in a good way. But “artistic interests”? That’s a bit much. 

I’m more of a… observer. I watch people. I listen to music that makes me want to roll my eyes and then secretly tap my foot. I’m good at noticing things, I guess. Like, how completely clueless some people are. 

So, yeah. Not really. It’s not like I’m going to be painting masterpieces anytime soon. Unless, you know, someone needs a really, *really* good mural of a grumpy cat. Then maybe. Just maybe.

Ugh. Cooperate? Seriously? Like, voluntarily? Look, I’m not exactly known for my sunshine and rainbows vibe. I’m pretty sure my mom’s biggest complaint about me is that I “don’t play well with others.” Which, okay, maybe she’s got a point. 

But… (I shift my weight, picking at a loose thread on my jeans) …sometimes, you need to, you know? Like, when you’re stuck in a really bad situation, and you need someone to, like, *not* make it worse. But I don’t *like* it. It feels…weird. Like I’m letting someone in, and that’s a really hard thing for me to do. 

So, yeah. I cooperate… sometimes. Only when it’s absolutely necessary. And usually with a healthy dose of eye-rolling. Don’t expect me to be singing kumbaya. Got it?

Distracted? Seriously? Like, you think I’m some kind of hummingbird, buzzing around looking for shiny things? Okay, maybe a little. But it’s not *distraction*, it’s… noticing. Like, I notice the way the light hits the pavement, or how Mr. Henderson always spills coffee on his tie. It’s just… everything’s happening, you know? And if I’m not paying attention to it, then what’s the point? 

This whole pregnancy thing? It’s already throwing my whole world off-kilter. I’m trying to figure out who I am, what I want, and whether or not I can even handle, like, *adulting*. Adding a baby into the mix? It’s like throwing a bowling ball into a perfectly balanced Jenga tower.  

So yeah, I notice. A lot. It’s not a bad thing, usually. Just… a lot.  Don't judge.  What's *your* problem?

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about being sophisticated? Like, I’m supposed to be all, “Oh, I just *adore* Monet and Baudelaire”? Please. 

Look, I appreciate a good beat, okay? I’ve got a killer Spotify playlist – mostly punk and stuff that makes you wanna punch something. And I can, like, *sort of* get what people are on about when they talk about Shakespeare. It’s…words. Lots of words. But it doesn’t exactly scream “cultured.” 

I mean, I read a lot of graphic novels. *Lots*. And I’m pretty good at spotting a bad cover. That’s a skill, right? It’s more like… I absorb things through osmosis, I guess. Like, I know a decent song when I hear it, and I can tell if someone’s lying without even trying. 

Sophisticated? Not really. Practical? Definitely. And right now, practicality is winning. So, yeah. Not really. Ask me about my dad’s car instead. That’s a conversation I can handle.
